title: Shipping Points of Interest, North Korea Uncovered
name: Shipping Points of Interest, North Korea Uncovered
description:
This is a kml file for shipping points of interest from North Korea Uncovered. 
This Google Earth project offers an extensive mapping of North Korea's economic, cultural, political, and military infrastructures. Through the topic menu, users of this program have easy access to geographical information on North Korea's agriculture projects, aviation facilities, communications, hospitals, hotels, energy infrastructure, financial services, leisure destinations, manufacturing facilities, markets, mines, religious locations, restaurants, schools, and transportation infrastructure. In addition to locations of economic interest, this map also displays anti-aircraft locations, the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) and Northern Line Limit Line (NLL), incarceration facilities, political monuments, political residencies, military bases, and nuclear facilities.

properties.name: Ryongnam Ship Repair Factory Dock No. 2.
properties.description:
http://www.kcckp.net/en/periodic/korea/index.php?contents+1299+2006-03+49+3

Dock No. 2 has been newly built at the Ryongnam Ship Repair Factory. Dock No. 2 is a computer-controlled dock capable of repairing several ships of tens of thousands of tons simultaneously. Its repair processes are equipped with latest machines and information technology has been introduced into them, with the result that it can markedly shorten the period of repair on a high level while saving a lot of manpower. 

In response to the call of the Workers’ Party of Korea for enhancing the repairing capacity of ships by building Dock No. 2, officials, workers and technicians of the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport completed in a short span of time the construction projects including a big dock, three wharves to handle and repair large cargo ships, a combined repair shop, an oxygen-generating shop, a wind and solar-cell power plant of peculiar type, houses for hundreds of families and service amenities. 

The reconstruction of the factory on a modern and expansion basis has laid more solid material and technological foundations of the country’s marine transport in line with the requirements of the new century. 

The leader Kim Jong Il provided on-the-spot guidance to newly-built Dock No. 2 in December last year. He highly praised the feats performed by the officials, workers and technicians of the ministry who have changed the factory into a leading ship repair base of the country in several years. Saying that the reconstructed and expanded Ryongnam Ship Repair Factory plays an important role in developing the country’s marine transport, he set forth the tasks to be fulfilled in managing and operating the factory. 

He then acquainted himself with how the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport constructed a container terminal in Nampho Port. 

Today all the employees of the ministry are filled with a resolve of loyalty to give full play to the mettle of Korean workers in the building of a great prosperous powerful nation by implementing without any reservation the tasks Kim Jong Il assigned to them while on his on-the-spot guidance to the factory.

properties.name: Ryongnam Ship Repair Factory Dock no.1
